articles.title: Officials Meet New Chinese Ambassador
articles.content:
Officials Meet New Chinese Ambassador
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, together with Kim Yang Gon, department director of the WPK Central Committee, met and had a talk with Liu Hongcai, new Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday when the latter paid a courtesy call on him.
					 On the same day, Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, had a conversation with the ambassador at the hall.

articles.title: Credentials of Pakistani Ambassador Accepted
articles.content:
Credentials of Pakistani Ambassador Accepted
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Arif Mahmood, Pakistani ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Thursday. 
					 After receiving the credentials the president had a conversation with the ambassador.

articles.title: New DPRK Ambassador to Laos Appointed
articles.content:
New DPRK Ambassador to Laos Appointed
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- Han Pong Ho was appointed as the DPRK ambassador to Laos, according to a decree of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly.

articles.title: Gift from Conservatory of Russia
articles.content:
Gift from Conservatory of Russia
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from Moscow Tchaikovsky State Conservatory of Russia.
					 The gift was handed to an official concerned by Alexandr Sokolov, president of the conservatory, on a visit to the DPRK.

articles.title: Opera "Evgeni Onegin" Staged
articles.content:
Opera "Evgeni Onegin" Staged
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- Opera "Evgeni Onegin" was staged at the East Pyongyang Grand Theatre on Thursday to mark the 61st anniversary of the conclusion of the agreement on economic and cultural cooperation between the DPRK and Russia.
					 Present there on invitation were Ambassador Valery Sukhinin and staff members of the Russian embassy and foreign diplomatic envoys and staff members of different embassies and missions of international organizations here.
					
					 Among the audience were Hong Son Ok, vice-chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who doubles as chairwoman of the DPRK-Russia Friendship Association, and officials of ministries and national institutions. 
					
					 The performance was acclaimed by the audience for its successful artistic representation of the ideological and thematic contents of the opera.

articles.title: Concert of Wartime Song Held
articles.content:
Concert of Wartime Song Held
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- A concert of wartime song "The Dear Home in My Native Village" given by artistes of the State Symphony Orchestra of the DPRK was held at the Moranbong Theater Wednesday.
					 Put on the stage were such colorful numbers as orchestral music "Cantata to Marshal Kim Il Sung", piano concerto "To a Decisive Battle", tenor solo "My Song in the Trench", symphonic poem "I Know It Now", soprano solo "Nobody Knows", symphony "The Dear Home in My Native Village".
					
					 Performers sang high praises of the historic victory the army and people of the DPRK won by decisively beating back the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces' aggression and honorably protecting the sovereignty of the country and the nation under the leadership of Kim Il Sung, the invincible and iron-willed commander.

articles.title: New Stamps Issued
articles.content:
New Stamps Issued
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- New stamps (two individual stamps) were issued in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 Seen in one of them are a soldier of the Korean People's Army and a member of the Worker-Peasant Red Guards determined to crush down at a stroke the U.S. imperialists hell bent on preparations of aggression on the DPRK. Reflected in the other is the Korean people's will to settle accounts with the Japanese reactionaries for their indelible crimes.    
					
					 Other four individual stamps representing different species of cats were also issued.

articles.title: More Data Disclosing US Provocation of War Displayed
articles.content:
More Data Disclosing US Provocation of War Displayed
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- The Kaesong City House of Class Education put on display over 60 more data disclosing the U.S. imperialists' moves to provoke a war.
					 Among them are photos and newspaper data proving that the U.S. imperialists, who occupied south Korea after Korea's liberation, deployed all types of artillery pieces and built a shell magazine in the area of Mt. Songak and Manwoltae, the site of the royal palace in the period of Koryo, and perpetrated ceaseless armed provocations. And there are data showing the frantic moves for a new war conducted by the U.S. imperialists in the areas along the Military Demarcation Line after the ceasefire.
					
					 Also displayed are the U.S. imperialists' shells and bullets discovered in the north side's portion of the Demilitarized Zone and photos showing bullet marks on the wall of the building of a nursery in Rimhan-ri, Kaesong City, etc.

articles.title: Musan Mining Complex with Large Deposit of Iron Ores
articles.content:
Musan Mining Complex with Large Deposit of Iron Ores
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- The Musan Mining Complex located in the northern inland area of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea is a leading iron ore producer of the country.
					 The complex has directed efforts to technical remodeling of equipment to boost iron ore production.
					
					 After conveyorizing the transport of ores to the dressing plant from stopes, it is now buckling down to a project of its capacity expansion, including installation of a large cone-shaped crusher with a daily capacity of tens of thousands of tons of earth-scraping.
					
					 It annually produces millions of tons of concentrated iron ores for the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex, Songjin Steel Complex and other major metallurgical works, contributing to the development of the country's independent industry.
					
					 Under deep care of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il the complex has turned into a giant iron ore producer embracing mountains terraced with stopes as well as up-to-date mining equipment. 
					
					 The complex has a deposit of billions of tons of high-grade iron ores.

articles.title: KCNA Dismisses US Reports on Human Rights Practices
articles.content:
KCNA Dismisses US Reports on Human Rights Practices  
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- The U.S. "Reports on Human Rights Practices for 2009" have been ridiculed by the international community.
					 The reports are nonsensical documents without any scientific accuracy as they grossly distorted human rights practices of many countries including the DPRK.
					
					 No country of the world recognizes such nonsensical documents and pays heed to them.
					
					 The U.S. claimed that it released the reports for "the protection of human rights." But it is a wanton violation of national sovereignty and a human rights abuse that the U.S. behaved as if it were "a human rights judge" in breach of the norm of international law calling for respect for sovereignty, though nobody entrusted such role to it.
					
					 It is none other than the U.S. that should be condemned for human rights abuses more bitterly than any others.
					
					 The U.S. is the worst country in the world where human existence and security are not guaranteed and elementary rights to social life are wantonly violated. 
					
					 In 2008, U.S. residents experienced 4.9 million violent crimes and therefore, a lot of Americans suffered from them, according to a report published by the U.S. Department of Justice in September 2009.
					
					In the U.S. it is the common life that individuals possess arms and kill each other. So, about 30,000 people die due to gun-related crimes and cases every year.
					
					 Unemployment, poverty and the homeless are very serious problems in the U.S. where working people's economic, social and cultural rights cannot be guaranteed. 
					
					Unemployment rate in the U.S. in 2009 was the highest in 26 years. And 39.8 million Americans were living in poverty by the end of 2008, an increase of 2.6 million over that in 2007. About 32,000 people commit suicides due to abject poverty in the U.S. each year, nearly double the cases of murder.
					
					 Dwelling houses should be cradles providing stable life and happiness to people. However, in the U.S. they have become objects of speculation and many people are left homeless in the same day. This is the American society where the people live in agony and despair due to the uncontrollable catastrophic financial and economic crises.
					
					 While vociferating about "freedom of speech" and "freedom of the press," the U.S. administration mercilessly abridges the freedom under various pretexts including that of "anti-terrorism."
					
					 The U.S. continued faking up information for the "war on terrorism" including the Iraqi war. This goes to patently prove how hypocritical and nonsensical the U.S. touted "freedom of the press" is.
					
					 After the U.S. invasion of Iraq in 2003, about one million civilians lost their lives in that country owing to the U.S. forces' military operations and violence, etc.
					
					 The "Abu Ghraib" prison bears witness to the shuddering human rights abuses being perpetrated by the U.S. forces in the "war on terrorism".
					
					 Americans' man-killing and human rights abuses are ceaselessly going on in Afghanistan and secret prisons in different parts of the world even today.
					
					 The U.S. is the country with the worst human rights record and the world's arch human rights abuser.
					
					 The U.S. interference in the internal affairs of other countries over human rights issues reminds one of a pupil trying to admonish his teacher.
					
					 How can the society where exploitation of man by man is institutionalized establish a correct conception on human rights? Is it possible to guarantee the genuine rights and ideal of the popular masses to lead a free and happy life in such unpopular country?
					
					 In the DPRK everything is made to serve the popular masses and the state enforces free health care and free compulsory education and provides them with de luxe houses free of charge. Is it conceivable in the U.S.?
					
					 As everything that cannot be dreamed of and everything impossible in the U.S. are becoming realities in the socialist society of the DPRK, its people devote themselves to the work for the country's prosperity and the victory of socialism with high pride and great attachment to it, and find worth and happiness in doing so. 
					
					 No matter what rhetoric the U.S. may let loose, the army and people of the DPRK will confidently consolidate the Korean style socialist system centered on the popular masses that has grown stronger thanks to the Songun politics.

articles.title: Japan Can Never Evade Responsibility to Settle Its Past Crimes
articles.content:
Japan Can Never Evade Responsibility to Settle Its Past Crimes
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- Many countries of the world are now paving the way for developing new relations through reconciliation and cooperation, liquidating their inglorious past in the international relations and solving the issues left unsettled in the post-war settlement. But it is only Japan that behaves quite contrary to this international trend.
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday observes this in a signed article.
					
					 It notes that the abnormal relations persist between the DPRK and Japan entirely because Japan is doggedly evading its responsibility to settle its past crimes, without honestly admitting and repenting of them.
					
					 It cites facts to prove that the Japanese imperialists committed hideous crimes, enforcing a harsh colonial fascist rule for about half a century after illegally occupying Korea by force of arms.
					
					 The article goes on:
					
					 It is hard to describe in words or writings all the crimes perpetrated by the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 Despite this hard fact, Japan has neither admitted nor made an apology for its past crimes though it is nearly 65 years since the defeat of the Japanese imperialists in the war. It is employing a cynical ploy to dodge its state responsibility for the crimes at any cost.
					
					 This betrays Japan's despicable nature and moral vulgarity.
					
					 The crimes Japan committed against the Korean people in the past can neither be covered up nor written off.
					
					 It is a legal and moral obligation for Japan to redeem its past crimes. This is also required by it, concludes the article.

articles.title: Devoted Service for People Called for
articles.content:
Devoted Service for People Called for
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- The DPRK is a genuine socialist state whose basic mission is to serve the popular masses, says Rodong Sinmun Thursday in a signed article.
					 The DPRK is a genuine people's country which ensures the position and role of the popular masses on the highest level, it notes, and goes on:
					
					 In the DPRK the broad popular masses directly choose their representatives through elections to power organs at all levels and get their will and wishes realized through them.
					
					 It is a socialist state centered on the popular masses which fully guarantees the people an independent and creative life.
					
					 It is the steadfast stand of the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK to always make the people central to every thinking and design and not to tolerate even the slightest element encroaching upon their interests.
					
					 The DPRK has paid primary attention to the people's living and channeled all efforts into the work for improving its standard and invariably pursued the popular policies such as free education and free medical care even under the conditions where everything was in short supply.
					
					 It is the WPK and the DPRK that make a flower come into bloom even on a rock, if desired by the people, and spare nothing for them.
					
					 The DPRK is now demonstrating its dignity as a political power which maintains a strong independent stand in the international arena, an invincible military power which no formidable enemy dares provoke and a scientific and technological power capable of successfully producing anything as it wishes under the great banner of Songun.

articles.title: US Urged to Lift Sanctions against DPRK in S. Korea
articles.content:
US Urged to Lift Sanctions against DPRK in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- The Buddhist Peace Solidarity of south Korea on March 11 sent a statement titled "We Demand the U.S. Immediately Lift Economic Sanctions against the North" to all media organizations of south Korea.
					 The statement termed the U.S. persistent economic sanctions against the DPRK a human rights abuse and an anti-peace atrocity.
					
					 All peace-loving people of the world urge the U.S. to immediately lift economic sanctions, stop anti-DPRK war exercises and opt for peace in Asia, the statement said.
					
					 Saying that no matter what economic embargo the U.S. may impose on the DPRK, Washington can never block its economic development, the statement held that it is because the DPRK has firmly preserved an independent and self-supporting national economy and socialist economy.
					
					 Referring to the madcap large-scale joint military exercises being staged in south Korea against the DPRK, the statement said that this indicates that the U.S. makes no scruple of committing whatever act of aggression to stifle the DPRK.
					
					 The statement urged the U.S. to stop hamstringing all efforts exerted by the DPRK for economic development and immediately retract "Resolution 1874" of the UN Security Council.
					
					 It strongly demanded on behalf of the Buddhists desirous of peace and reunification that the U.S. immediately stop its ceaseless acts of aggression and man-killings against countries hostile to it and lift economic sanctions against the DPRK.

articles.title: Songun Politics Supported by Mexican Party Leader
articles.content:
Songun Politics Supported by Mexican Party Leader
Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- The Songun politics pursued by General Secretary Kim Jong Il is the most just politics and an all-powerful treasured sword, and thanks to this politics the sovereignty of the DPRK and its dignity are firmly protected.
					 Alberto Anaya Gutierrez, coordinator of the National Coordinating Committee of the Workers' Party of Mexico, said this when meeting the delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea led by the DPRK ambassador to Mexico on March 10.
					
					 The Workers' Party of Mexico fully supports the Songun politics, he said, stressing that he would make positive efforts to develop the friendly and cooperative relations with the WPK in various fields in the future.

articles.title: Joint Military Exercises Blasted in Other Countries
articles.content:
Joint Military Exercises Blasted in Other Countries
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the All-Union Communist Party of Bolsheviks of Russia and the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Bangladesh denounced the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises being staged by the U.S. and south Korean puppet warmongers.
					 The Central Committee of the All-Union Communist Party of Bolsheviks in its statement on March 9 accused the U.S. imperialist aggressors of making desperate efforts to ignite a war on the Korean Peninsula in order to bring the independent and brave Korean people accelerating the building of a thriving nation to their knees.
					
					 The All-Union Communist Party of Bolsheviks fully supports the measures taken by the DPRK to cope with the touch-and-go situation prevailing on the Korean Peninsula again created by the U.S. and south Korean authorities, the statement said, calling upon the governments and working people of all the countries to take strong actions against the U.S. criminal war moves.
					
					 The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Bangladesh in its statement on March 15 recalled that the large-scale war exercises were kicked off by the U.S. and south Korean authorities after the DPRK proposed an early start of the talks for concluding a peace treaty, adding that this clearly indicates that the U.S. policy to stifle the socialist system chosen by the Korean people themselves remains unchanged.
					
					 The statement extended full support and solidarity to the Korean people in their efforts to bolster up their nuclear deterrent to cope with the U.S. nuclear threat and provocations.
					
					 Meanwhile, the U.S. branch of the Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain released a statement in denunciation of the above-said joint military exercises on March 5 and the Group of Youth for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea in Austria released a similar statement on March 15.

articles.title: Day of Sun Commemorated in Finland
articles.content:
Day of Sun Commemorated in Finland
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- A rally for commemorating the Day of the Sun took place in Finland on March 9.
					Put on display in the venue of the rally were works of peerlessly great men President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and photos showing their undying feats.
					
					 The participants laid bouquets before their portraits and paid tribute to them.
					
					 Kalevi Warman, chairman of the Finnish Communists' League, in a speech made at the rally praised Kim Il Sung as a paragon of ardent patriots and genuine revolutionaries who devoted his all to the country and its people and the world revolution.
					
					 The immortal Juche idea fathered by Kim Il Sung serves as valuable guidelines clearly indicating the way to be followed not only by the Korean people but also by the progressive people in their struggle for the cause of global independence and the socialist movement, the chairman said.
					
					 Noting that under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il, the Korean people are waging a dynamic struggle to open the gate to a great prosperous and powerful socialist nation in 2012, the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung, he expressed support and solidarity with their just cause.
					
					 A message to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the rally.

articles.title: Story of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Story of Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il made public a famous work, "Let Us Turn Pyongyang, Capital of the Revolution, into a Magnificent City of the People," on March 18, Juche 64 (1975).
					 In the work he, noting Pyongyang is not only the capital of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea but the holy land of revolution, said that the Juche-oriented architectural idea of the Workers' Party of Korea should be applied thoroughly in the construction of Pyongyang and that many modern dwellings, public establishments, parks and pleasure grounds should be built in the city for the people.
					
					 He underscored the need to mechanize and modernize construction work and create new methods of construction and called on broad masses of people to take part in the capital city construction.
					
					 Since the work was published, enormous efforts for facelifting Pyongyang have been made. Many streets, including Changgwang, Kwangbok and Thongil Streets, mushroomed and radical changes have been brought about in construction and people's living standard in the capital.
					
					 The Mansudae Art Theatre, Pyongyang Maternity Hospital, Changgwang Health Complex, Ice Rink and many other monumental edifices of the WPK era were constructed and the Pyongyang Grand Theatre, Moranbong Theatre, Taedongmun Cinema and other entertainment facilities reconstructed.
					
					 Some time ago tens of multi-storied apartment buildings, public buildings, various welfare service amenities, a wooded area and park came into being in Mansudae Street to provide a model for the construction of 100,000 dwellings which will appear in Pyongyang within a few years.

articles.title: Nombrado nuevo embajador coreano en Laos
articles.content:
Nombrado nuevo embajador coreano en Laos
Pyongyang, 18 de marzo (ATCC) -- Segun el decreto del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Han Pong Ho fue nombrado como  embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la RPDC en la Republica Democratica Popular Lao.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe regalo de Conservatorio Estatal Chaikovski
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe regalo de Conservatorio Estatal Chaikovski
Pyongyang, 18 de marzo (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il recibio el regalo que le enviara el Conservatorio Estatal de Moscu Chaikovski de Rusia.
					  El rector de este plantel docente Alexandr Sokolov, que se encuentra de visita en Corea, lo entrego a un funcionario coreano.

articles.title: ATCC rechaza informe de DDHH de EE.UU.
articles.content:
ATCC rechaza informe de DDHH de EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 18 de marzo (ATCC) -- Es ridiculizado en escala internacional el "informe anual de la situacion mundial de DDHH para 2009" publicado recientemente por EE.UU.
					  Ese informe, que tergiversa gravemente la situacion de DDHH de muchos paises incluso la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, deviene un absurdo documento carente de fundamento cientifico.
					
					  Si bien EE.UU. dice que publica ese informe para la "defensa de los DDHH", ningun pais del mundo lo reconoce ni mucho menos le hace caso.
					
					  Ese imperio actua como "juez de DDHH" no autorizado por nadie violando ilegalmente la norma del derecho internacional de respetar la soberania, lo cual constituye flagrante violacion del poder estatal y los DDHH de otros paises.
					
					  EE.UU. es precisamente el peor violador de DDHH que debe ser cuestionado y condenado mas.
					
					  En este mundo no hay otro pais como EE.UU. en que no se garantizan la existencia y la seguridad del ser humano y se violan despiadadamente hasta los derechos elementales de la vida social.
					
					  Segun los datos publicados en septiembre de 2009 por el Departamento de Justicia norteamericano, en EE.UU. se reportaron en 2008 4 millones 900 mil crimenes de violencia en que resultaron victimas numerosas personas.
					
					  En ese pais, donde se hizo algo cotidiano la matanza reciproca entre los individuos armados, se registran cada ano casi 30 mil muertes inocentes por esta causa o en casos accidentales.
					
					  Tambien, resultan muy graves en EE.UU. los problemas del desempleo, la pobreza y la vivienda y no pueden ser garantizados los derechos economicos y socio-culturales de las masas trabajadoras.
					
					  En el 2009 la tasa de desempleo marco el record de los ultimos 26 anos y el numero de los pobres llego a finales de 2008 a 39 millones 800 mil con un aumento de 2 millones 600 mil en comparacion con 2007.
					
					  Ademas, se suicidan cada ano 32 mil personas aproximadamente lamentando su extremada pobreza y este numero es casi el doble de la cifra de los asesinados.
					
					Al convertirse en el objeto de especulacion las viviendas que deben servir de cuna de vida estable y feliz de las personas, decenas de miles se quedaron sin hogar al mismo tiempo.
					
					Para colmo, la devastadora crisis economica financiera, producto de esa especulacion, llevo a ellos a los sufrimientos mayores y a la desesperacion.
					
					Esto es precisamente la infernal sociedad norteamericana.
					
					  La administracion norteamericana habla de la "libertad de la palabra" y "la de prensa", por una parte, y, por la otra, las reprime despiadadamente bajo varios pretextos como el "antiterrorismo".
					
					  Las desinformaciones que se inventan de continuo en la guerra iraqui y otras "guerras antiterroristas" demuestran cuan enganosa y absurda es la "libertad de prensa" de que habla EE.UU.
					
					  Desde 2003 cuando EE.UU. invadio a Irak hasta la fecha, en este pais persico murieron mas de un millon de civiles en las operaciones militares y los casos de violencia cometidos por las tropas norteamericanas.
					
					  El nombre de la carcel iraqui "Abu Ghraib" es el simbolo de los escalofriantes y asquerosos actos de violacion de DDHH perpetrados por las tropas norteamericanas en la "guerra antiterrorista".
					
					  El homicidio y la violacion a DDHH de EE.UU. no cesan hasta hoy en Afganistan y las prisiones secretas instaladas en todas partes del mundo.
					
					  EE.UU. es el pais mas atrasado en el campo de DDHH y causante de los flagelos de DDHH de talla mundial.
					
					  Por lo tanto, la intervencion de este pais en el problema de DDHH de otros paises resulta tan ridicula y absurda como la conducta de un alumno que quiere instruir a su maestro.
					
					Como es posible que esa sociedad, que permite institucionalmente la explotacion del hombre, conciba la correcta concepcion sobre los derechos humanos?
					
					Y como van a realizarse en ese pais tan antipopular los verdaderos derechos e ideales de las masas populares de vivir libre y felizmente?
					
					  En EE.UU. no se puede imaginar la realidad de la RPDC donde todo sirve para las masas populares y el Estado les asegura el tratamiento medico gratuito y la educacion obligatoria gratuita y les ofrece gratis hasta las viviendas de maximo nivel.
					
					  La sociedad coreana es la socialista en que se concretan en hechos los ideales inimaginables e irrealizables en EE.UU.
					
					  Por esta razon, el pueblo coreano se siente orgulloso de su sociedad, la ama tanto y busca el valor y felicidad de su vida en trabajar con mucho entusiasmo por la prosperidad de la patria y el triunfo del socialismo.
					
					  Por mucho que EE.UU. hable mal, el ejercito y el pueblo de Corea seguiran fortaleciendo sin vacilacion el regimen socialista al estilo coreano centrado en las masas populares, que se vio consolidado con el poderio del Songun (priorizacion militar).

articles.title: Partidos y entidades extranjeros condenan "Key Resolve"-"Aguilucho"
articles.content:
Partidos y entidades extranjeros condenan "Key Resolve"-"Aguilucho"
						
Pyongyang, 18 de marzo (ATCC) -- Los comites centrales del Partido Comunista Bolchevique de Toda la Union de Rusia y del Partido del Trabajo de Bangladesh expresaron el repudio a los entrenamientos militares conjuntos "Key Resolve" y "Aguilucho" de los Estados Unidos y los belicistas titeres surcoreanos.
					En su declaracion fechada 9, el Comite Central del partido ruso destaco que los agresivos imperialistas norteamericanos actuan siniestramente para doblegar al independiente y valiente pueblo coreano, que acelera la construccion de una gran potencia prospera, al provocar la guerra en la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Apunto que su partido apoya activamente todas las medidas tomadas por la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea frente a la situacion a punto de explosion que estan dando de nuevo los Estados Unidos y las autoridades surcoreanas en la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Y exhorto a todos los gobiernos y los trabajadores del mundo que luchen resueltamente contra las criminales maniobras de guerra de Estados Unidos.
					
					El Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Bangladesh, en su declaracion publicada el dia 15, revelo que es invariable la politica de EE.UU. de aplastar el regimen socialista optado por el pueblo coreano precisando que los citados ejercicios militares se realizan poco despues de que la RPDC propusiera iniciar cuanto antes las conversaciones sobre la concertacion del convenio de paz.
					
					Y expreso el apoyo total y la solidaridad con la lucha del pueblo coreano por consolidar aun mas el disuasivo nuclear frente a la amenaza nuclear y las provocaciones de EE.UU.
					
					Por otra parte, la sucursal de EE.UU. de la Asociacion de Amistad con Corea que tienen su sede en Espana y el Grupo de los Jovenes de Estudio de la Idea Juche Kim Jong Il en Austria hicieron publicas los dias 5 y 15 sendas declaraciones condenando los mismos entrenamientos militares EE.UU.-Sur de Corea.
